# `classify` {#classify-subcommand .unnambered}

The `classify` subcommand classifies genomes into cliques (k-complete) graphs based on ANI results, generating plots and tabular summaries. This is helpful for circumscribing potentially meaningful groups of genomes that can not be described using traditional taxonomy. The output, including classify plots (`JPG`, `PDF`, `PNG`, `SVGZ`) and tabular data, is written to `outdir` directory.

```shell
$ pyani-plus classify -h

 Classify genomes into clusters based on ANI results.

│ *  --outdir            DIRECTORY            Output directory. If it does not      │
│                                             exist, it will be created.            │
│                                             [required]                            │
│    --run-id            INTEGER              Which run from the database (defaults │
│                                             to latest)                            │
│                                             [default: None]                       │
│    --label             [md5|filename|stem]  How to label the genomes              │
│                                             [default: stem]                       │
│    --help      -h                           Show this message and exit.           │
╰───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯

│                                                    [default: min]                 │
│ --score-edges           TEXT                       How to resolve asymmetrical    │
│                                                    ANI identity/tANI results for  │
│                                                    edges in the graph (min, max   │
│                                                    or mean).                      │
│                                                    [default: mean]                │
│ --vertical-line         FLOAT RANGE [x<=1.0]       Threshold for red vertical     │

╰───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯


```
